page.title: 03MR. BEST,N.A.H.T. PRESIDENT
page.content: Mr. Best J.P. M.A. is the headmaster of Vyners Comprehensive School. Vyners is a mixed school with an age group of 11-16. Mr. Best also holds the position of president of the National Association of Headteachers (N.A.H.T). He has been teaching since September 1954, and has been a headmaster for 17 years (since January 1968).He has held a number of different positions in his union:- (in order) local branch president, national council member, chairman of a comittee of professional advice,vice president(in 1983/84) and finally he became president. Mr. Best was not worried when he recently appeared on television because he did not have time to think about it. But he finds that when he has advance knowledge of an appearance he gets nervous.He finds that being president has helped him to socialise.
